6use crate::{
7	error::{Error, MatrixError},
8	CLIENT
9};
10use derive_getters::Getters;
11use reqwest::Url;
12use serde::{Deserialize, Deserializer, Serialize, Serializer};
13use std::{
14	fmt::{Debug, Display},
15	ops::Deref,
16	sync::Arc
17};
18use stickerpicker::StickerWidget;
19use thiserror::Error;
20
21/// Matrix file url.
22///
23/// Store matrix file url and provide a cache for the data of the file, to avoid unecessary reqwest
24/// Will be serialize/deserialize as normal [String], conaining only the url.
25#[derive(Clone, Getters)]
26pub struct Mxc {
27	url: String,
28	/// file data of the url, if cached
29	pub(crate) data: Option<Arc<Vec<u8>>>
30}
31impl Mxc {
32	/// create new [Mxc] from matrix url and optional assioated file data
33	pub fn new(url: String, data: Option<Arc<Vec<u8>>>) -> Self {
34		Self { url, data }
35	}
36
37	/// fetch data, if not cached
38	pub async fn fetch_data(&self) -> &Vec<u8> {
39		if let Some(data) = &self.data {
40			return data;
41		};
42		unimplemented!() //TODO
43	}
44}
45impl From<String> for Mxc {
46	fn from(val: String) -> Self {
47		Mxc { url: val, data: None }
48	}
49}
50
51impl AsRef<String> for Mxc {
52	fn as_ref(&self) -> &String {
53		&self.url
54	}
55}
56impl Deref for Mxc {
57	type Target = String;
58
59	fn deref(&self) -> &Self::Target {
60		&self.url
61	}
62}
63impl Debug for Mxc {
64	fn fmt(&self, f: &mut std::fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> std::fmt::Result {
65		Debug::fmt(&self.url, f)
66	}
67}
68impl Display for Mxc {
69	fn fmt(&self, f: &mut std::fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> std::fmt::Result {
70		Display::fmt(&self.url, f)
71	}
72}
73impl PartialEq for Mxc {
74	fn eq(&self, other: &Self) -> bool {
75		self.url.eq(&other.url)
76	}
77}
78impl Eq for Mxc {
79	fn assert_receiver_is_total_eq(&self) {
80		self.url.assert_receiver_is_total_eq()
81	}
82}
83
84impl<'de> Deserialize<'de> for Mxc {
85	fn deserialize<D>(deserializer: D) -> Result<Self, D::Error>
86	where
87		D: Deserializer<'de>
88	{
89		let url = String::deserialize(deserializer)?;
90		Ok(Self { url, data: None })
91	}
92}
93impl Serialize for Mxc {
94	fn serialize<S>(&self, serializer: S) -> Result<S::Ok, S::Error>
95	where
96		S: Serializer
97	{
98		serializer.serialize_str(&self.url)
99	}
100}
101
102#[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
103pub struct Config {
104	pub homeserver_url: String,
105	pub user: String,
106	pub access_token: String
107}
108
109/// see <https://spec.matrix.org/latest/client-server-api/#standard-error-response>
110#[derive(Debug, Deserialize, Error)]
111#[error("Matrix api request was not successful: {errcode} {error}")]
112pub struct MatrixApiError {
113	/// see <https://spec.matrix.org/latest/client-server-api/#common-error-codes>
114	pub errcode: String,
115	/// A human-readable error message.
116	pub error: String,
117	/// ratelimit timeout
118	pub retry_after_ms: Option<u32>
119}
120
121#[allow(dead_code)]
122#[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
123pub struct Whoami {
124	user_id: String,
125	device_id: String
126}
127
128#[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
129struct MatrixContentUri {
130	content_uri: String
131}
132
133pub async fn set_widget(matrix: &Config, sender: String, url: String) -> Result<(), Error> {
134	let stickerwidget = StickerWidget::new(url, sender);
135	let answer = CLIENT
136		.get()
137		.put(format!(
138			"{}/_matrix/client/r0/user/{}/account_data/m.widgets",
139			matrix.homeserver_url, matrix.user
140		))
141		.query(&[("access_token", &matrix.access_token)])
142		.header("Content-Type", "application/json")
143		.json(&stickerwidget)
144		.send()
145		.await?;
146	if answer.status() != 200 {
147		let status = answer.status();
148		let error: Result<MatrixApiError, _> = answer.json().await;
149		return Err(Error::MatrixUpload(MatrixError {
150			status_code: status,
151			filename: None,
152			matrix_error: error
153		}));
154	}
155	Ok(())
156}
157
158pub async fn whoami(matrix: &Config) -> Result<Mxc, Error> {
159	Url::parse(&matrix.homeserver_url)?; //check if homeserver_url is a valid url
160	let answer = CLIENT
161		.get()
162		.get(format!("{}/_matrix/client/r0/account/whoami", matrix.homeserver_url))
163		.query(&[("access_token", &matrix.access_token)])
164		.send()
165		.await?;
166	if answer.status() != 200 {
167		let status = answer.status();
168		let error: Result<MatrixApiError, _> = answer.json().await;
169		Err(Error::MatrixUpload(MatrixError {
170			status_code: status,
171			filename: None,
172			matrix_error: error
173		}))
174	} else {
175		Ok(answer.json().await?)
176	}
177}
178
179pub(crate) async fn upload(matrix: &Config, filename: &String, data: Arc<Vec<u8>>, mimetype: &str) -> Result<Mxc, Error> {
180	let mut mxc = upload_ref(matrix, filename, data.as_slice(), mimetype).await?;
181	mxc.data = Some(data);
182	Ok(mxc)
183}
184
185pub(crate) async fn upload_ref(matrix: &Config, filename: &String, data: &[u8], mimetype: &str) -> Result<Mxc, Error> {
186	let answer = CLIENT
187		.get()
188		.post(&format!("{}/_matrix/media/r0/upload", matrix.homeserver_url))
189		.query(&[("access_token", &matrix.access_token), ("filename", filename)])
190		.header("Content-Type", mimetype)
191		.body(data.to_owned()) //TODO check for better solution
192		.send()
193		.await?;
194	if answer.status() != 200 {
195		let status = answer.status();
196		let error: Result<MatrixApiError, _> = answer.json().await;
197		return Err(Error::MatrixUpload(MatrixError {
198			status_code: status,
199			filename: Some(filename.to_owned()),
200			matrix_error: error
201		}));
202	}
203	let content_uri: MatrixContentUri = answer.json().await?;
204	Ok(content_uri.content_uri.into())
205}
